title: The Denver Omelet Recipe
description: This Denver omelet is Chef John's version of beaten eggs firmly cooked and filled with green bell pepper, smoked ham, onions, and Cheddar cheese.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Breakfast and Brunch Eggs Omelet Recipes The Denver Omelet 4.9 (81) 55 Reviews 15 Photos The Denver omelet is a change of pace from a French omelet and is known for its firmer texture and caramelized flavor. It's one of the first foods I learned to cook professionally as a line cook in high school. Make it a complete lunch or dinner with arugula salad and toasted bread. By John Mitzewich John Mitzewich John Mitzewich ‚Äî aka Chef John ‚Äî has produced more than 1,500 cooking videos for Allrecipes.¬†He's the actor, director, and screenwriter whose hands and voice confidently walk you through techniques. Allrecipes' editorial guidelines Updated on February 28, 2025 Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 15 15 15 15 Prep Time: 10 mins Cook Time: 10 mins Total Time: 20 mins Servings: 1 Yield: 1 omelet Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 1 servings 3 large eggs 1 tablespoon butter ¬º cup diced smoked ham 2 tablespoons diced onion 2 tablespoons diced green bell pepper salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste ‚Öì cup shredded Cheddar cheese 1 pinch cayenne pepper Directions Gather all ingredients. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Beat eggs in a small bowl until just combined; do not overbeat. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Melt butter in a skillet over medium-high heat. Add ham, onion, and bell pepper; season with salt and pepper. Cook and stir until onions soften and ham begins to caramelize, about 5 minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Reduce heat to medium-low and pour in eggs. Mix briefly with a spatula while shaking the pan to ensure ingredients are evenly distributed. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Quickly run the spatula along edges of omelet. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Sprinkle Cheddar cheese and cayenne pepper over omelet. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Cook, shaking the pan occasionally, until top is still wet but not runny, about 5 minutes. Use a spatula to fold omelet in half and transfer it to a plate. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios I Made It Print 188 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 527 Calories 39g Fat 9g Carbs 34g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 1 Calories 527 % Daily Value * Total Fat 39g 50% Saturated Fat 19g 97% Cholesterol 633mg 211% Sodium 851mg 37% Total Carbohydrate 9g 3% Dietary Fiber 1g 3% Total Sugars 3g Protein 34g 68% Vitamin C 19mg 21% Calcium 363mg 28% Iron 3mg 17% Potassium 383mg 8% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of The Denver Omelet 01 of 15 Photo by¬† Dotdash Meredith Food Studios 02 of 15 Photo by¬† HLE 02/18/2025 A keeper! New family favoriteü•∞ Our kid usually hates eggs but he‚Äôs in love with Chef John‚Äôs quiche Lorraine and this Denver omelette! 03 of 15 Photo by¬† TxCin2 02/07/2025 This was simple to follow and it was certainly filling. I made this for my lunch and it will keep me going until dinner for sure. I used diced pimento from a jar instead of fresh pepper and it worked out fine. I did add a splash of heavy cream to my eggs and then I added the cayenne too so it was evenly distributed. I used a 12 inch pan, but should have used a smaller one, as the egg spread so thin that it was really hard to fold over without tearing. It did not affect the taste one bit. I turned the heat down to med-low before adding the egg, but it was still a bit hot and the egg was getting too brown before the top was set. Now I know to turn it down to low about 2 1/2 on my stove so it can cook through before it gets too dark on the bottom. I didn't think I could eat 3 eggs, but I only left a couple of bites, so this must have been good. I don't usually like eggs, but I am learning how to find ways that work for me and this is a winner. Even though I used block cheddar, I'll bet this would work with plastic cheese singles just as well. I served this ketchup on the side but it didn't have enough zip, so the next time, I'll bring out the hot sauce. Thanks Chef John for another winner, winner, chicken dinner! (chicken egg, that is). 04 of 15 Photo by¬† Kerry R Heath Wuthrich 08/09/2024 Great flavors Easy to follow A keeper! The only things I modified were using both butter and olive oil, red and green bell peppers, and maybe 2T unflavored bubbly water in the eggs (any brand will do for added fluffiness). I also flipped it after enough of the eggs were cooked so as not to make a splash. My ham and veggie mix was 3.5oz after cooking, so that may be a little larger proportion than the recipe called for, but I felt it was restaurant worthy! I will keep this in mind when cooking for friends and family! 05 of 15 Photo by¬† Graeme 07/21/2021 06 of 15 Photo by¬† Esther Mbiwan 10/23/2020 07 of 15 Photo by¬† David 06/22/2020 08 of 15 Photo by¬† Rose Marshall 10/20/2019 09 of 15 Photo by¬† Andy Schindler 08/07/2019 10 of 15 Photo by¬† Skyler Call 04/05/2019 1 2 Next You‚Äôll Also Love Western Omelet 4 Ratings Asparagus Omelet 8 Ratings Ultimate Low-Carb Ham and Cheese Omelet for Two 2 Ratings Ham and Cheese Omelette 11 Ratings New Colorado Omelet 5 Ratings One-Pan Ham and Eggs 1 Rating Keto Buffalo Chicken Omelette 1 Rating Madame Cristo - Grilled Ham and Cheese 63 Ratings Paleo Omelet Muffins 267 Ratings Buffalo Wings and Blue Cheese Omelet Chicken Egg Foo Young 1 Rating Oeufs Cocotte (Baked Eggs) 17 Ratings Sharon's Egg and Ham Scramble 29 Ratings Ham and Cheddar Mini Quiche 3 Ratings Kylie's Ham Delights 27 Ratings Candice's Lasagna Omelet 2 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices ¬† Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith¬†publishing¬†family. name: John Mitzewich
